Package de.freaklamarsch.systarest

Class CircularBuffer<E>

java.lang.Object
de.freaklamarsch.systarest.CircularBuffer<E>
Type Parameters:
E - object type to store within this buffer
public class CircularBuffer<E>
extends java.lang.Object
Implementation of a circular buffer. A circular buffer is a data structure that uses a single, fixed-size buffer (FiFo) as if it were connected end-to-end. By default, this implementation denies adding new elements if the buffer is full. This behavior can be changed by setting overwrite

  • Constructor Details

    • CircularBuffer

      public CircularBuffer​(int capacity)
      Creates a CircularBuffer with a capacity of capacity elements.
      Parameters:
      capacity - number of elements that can be stored in the CircularBuffer

  • Method Details

    • clear

      public void clear()
      moves the markers to represent an empty buffer. Note, this does not immediately destroy the stored elements in the buffer.

    • add

      public boolean add​(E element)
      Add an element to the end of CircularBuffer
      Parameters:
      element - the element added to the CircularBuffer
      Returns:
      true if the element could be added to the buffer, false otherwise

    • remove

      public E remove()
      Removes the oldest element from the CircularBuffer and returns it
      Returns:
      the oldest element

    • peek

      public E peek()
      Returns:
      the oldest element from the buffer without removing it

    • end

      public E end()
      Returns:
      the newest element from the buffer without removing it

    • capacity

      public int capacity()
      Returns:
      the capacity of the CircularBuffer

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns:
      the size of the CircularBuffer, i.e. elements currently stored.

    • setOverwrite

      public void setOverwrite​(boolean overwrite)
      Parameters:
      overwrite - Set the behavior if an element is added to a full CircularBuffer. If set to true, the oldest element is overwritten. If set to false, add will ignore the add request and return false.

    • getOverwrite

      public boolean getOverwrite()
      Returns:
      the current value of overwrite

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Returns:
      if this CircularBuffer is empty or not.

    • isFull

      public boolean isFull()
      Returns:
      if this CircularBuffer is full or not.

    • isNotEmpty

      private boolean isNotEmpty()

    • isNotFull

      private boolean isNotFull()
